scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
IPv4 is included in 2 national catalogues, which belong to Member States which comply with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to the NIFO factsheets. These two Member States are the Netherlands and Sweden. 

See:                                                                                                                                               
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement: The specification is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specificationÂ
statement:
IETF has a formal review and approval so that all the relevant stakeholders can formally appeal or raise objections to the development and approval of specifications.

Each distinct version of an Internet standards-related specification is published as part of the "Request for Comments" (RFC) document series. This archival series is the official publication channel for Internet standards documents and other publications.

During the development of a specification, draft versions of the document are made available for informal review and comment by placing them in the IETF's "Internet-Drafts" directory, which is replicated on a number of Internet hosts. This makes an evolving working document readily available to a wide audience, facilitating the process of review and revision.

See:
https://www.ietf.org/standards/process/ 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2026

statement:
IPv4 is publicly available for implementation and use, and therefore for everyone to study, for free on IETF webpage. 
See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc791
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1349
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2474
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6864

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, IPv4 is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. IPv4 is therefore licensed on a royalty-free basis.
See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, IPv4 is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. IPv4 is therefore licensed on a royalty-free basis.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
As the internet protocol stack, it allows connections and data exchange all over the internet. The internet protocol is the main enabler element to perform communications over networks. This fact together with its long haul demonstrates the market acceptance and the maturity for its use development of services and products. Moreover, the European Regional Internet Registry has a high number of IPs available in order to provide them when necessary.

Even though, it is worth mentioning that IPv6 it is being gradually adopted by suppliers, vendors and public services. However, there are existing translation and transition methods between both versions that allow the normal connection between nodes using different Internet Protocol versions

See: 
https://www.ripe.net/publications/news/about-ripe-ncc-and-ripe/getting-ready-for-ipv4-run-out

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
At the moment of performing the assessment, the IPv4 is widely adopted as a key point on making data, information, and resources available on the internet.  However, it is worth to point out that the new version recently is being gradually adopted including several innovative solutions. Furthermore, there are already transition mechanisms to connect nodes using different versions of the Internet protocol. 
Nevertheless, the European Commission has endorsed the adoption of IPv6 in new initiatives in order to ease the transition to the new version of the protocol. 
See: 
https://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:52002DC0096:EN:HTML

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
IPv4 is maintained and developed by IETF which is an international community developing open standards. 
Additionally, it has support from the different Regional Internet Registries (RIRs) in order to ensure the proper development beyond borders. 
See: 
https://www.arin.net/
https://www.ripe.net/
https://afrinic.net/
https://www.apnic.net/
https://www.lacnic.net/

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement: As Internet Protocol Stack, IPv4 has been selected by a wide range of European public administrations in order to ensure the data exchange between its different stakeholders. Therefore, the adoption of IPv4 fosters the administration's data visibility and eases the decision-making process.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: The Internet Protocol is a key point in the data exchange through the internet. In its aim to ensure communication over computer networks eases the availability of interfaces with internal information. This fact allows the administrations to exchange and reuse data with each other.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.Â
statement: IPv4 is a sector agnostic specification that allows its implementation independently form the business domain.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
The specification is available for its use and implementation at the EITF's webpage defined in several RFCs. 
See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc791 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1349
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2474
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6864

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement: IPv4 is the previous version of the Internet Protocol, but it is widely adopted and still prevailing. The newest has specific features and improves security aspects. Even the IPv6 it is being gradually implemented and included in new initiatives, the existing translation and transition mechanisms between versions avoid the interoperability hampering.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The purpose of the IPv4 is to enable communications over the internet, so much so it does not hamper the scalability of systems. By using IPv4, administrations, citizens or businesses can provide or consume data over the Internet without hampering the interoperability between systems.  
Despite the progressive adoption of the new version, IPv4 and IPv6 are meant to coexist for years. The mechanisms to enable the compatibility avoid interoperability hampering.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:
IPv4 is a protocol that allows the exchange of data through the internet, therefore, the specifications fosters the data portability. Moreover, the European Commission launched in 2012 a programme to ensure the coexistence and the proper transition to the new version of internet protocol.
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/commission/presscorner/detail/en/MEMO_12_414

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement: The Internet Protocol is a necessary specification for the implementation of the once-only-principle as it allows cross-border communications over the internet.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of IPv4 is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
Internet Protocol Security (IPsec), a protocol providing a network layer security (authentication and encryption), is an optional feature that allows the Internet Protocol to secure the data exchange. However, in the latest version of the protocol (IPv6), the feature has been included as mandatory enhancing security settings. 

See: 
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc791
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1349
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2474
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6864
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2460

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: The purpose of IPv4 is not related to the delivery of multilingual services. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement:
As a protocol which allows the data exchange over the internet, IPv4 contributes to the information and data exchange between administrations. Therefore, avoids the non-digital exchange of data reducing the administrative burden.
Additionally, as it is available for free contributes to the reduction of administrative burden.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The purpose of IPv4 is not related to long term preservation of electronic records. Therefore this criterion is considered not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement:
There are existing documentation and studies assessing the effectiveness and efficiency of IPv4. It is a constant in studies the comparison between both versions, IPv4 and IPv6. As well, the studies show the relevance of coexisting before finding the most efficient method to move on from one protocol to another. 
See:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/317135434_A_STUDY_ON_IPv4_and_IPv6_THE_IMPORTANCE_OF_THEIR_CO-EXISTENCE
https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/3455/fdc0741edc3263295ae8d0c226119613db81.pdf
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/224593091_A_comparative_review_of_IPv4_and_IPv6_for_research_test_bed

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
IPv4 is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). More specifically, IPv4 can define the interoperability aspects of the "Network", "Networking Service", "Private Network" and "Public Network" ABBs of the EIRA Technical Application View.

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There is no conformity test coming from the IETF, but there are existing IPv4 test suits for free and underpayment. 
See:
http://www.qkdnetsim.info/doc/html/ipv4-test_8cc.html

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement:
6 Member States are recommending IPv6 in their ICT National Catalogues. 

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
IPv4 has been selected within the cross-border project of The Compendium from the National Research and Education Networks in Europe (NREN). The Compendium structures its services in an IP-based network using mainly IPv4. The protocol acts as the backbone of the Pan-European network provided by GEANT.

See: 
https://www.geant.org/Resources/Documents/Compendium2016.pdf
https://www.geant.org/Networks/Pan-European_network/Pages/Home.aspx

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 6 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. Some examples of Member States including IPv4 on their catalogues are the Netherlands or Sweden.   

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement: After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of IPv4 within any European catalogue of standards.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidence has been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

statement: After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of IPv4 is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

statement: The purpose of IPv4 is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement: Information shared by an IPv4 packet, which is the smallest message entity exchanged via the Internet Protocol, contains structured information which can be considered a cross-border reusable data model. That structure is relevant for proper consumption and data exchange.

criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement: The specification is not related to the publication of public data as open data. Therefore this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
One of the RFCs defining the IPv4 is available at the European collaborative platform Joinup. However, the other documents defining the specifications are not available at any European platform. 
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/ietf-rfc-791-1980-internet-protocol/distribution/ietf-rfc-791-1980-internet-protocol
